CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 11, 1961, pg. 14A, reads: "D.I. Models who made the annual benefit style show and dance a fascinating evening at Holiday House just outside of Pittsburgh, show the winning ways that turned hundreds of guests into delighted patrons...Dolly Mollix, one of the stars of the show, whose outfits were designed by her mother. The nine hand-picked models showed the famous DuPont collection, which is created each year just for the National Foundation (March of Dimes). The D.I.'s headed by Gay DeHall, have as their sole project the National Foundation, and they plan to sponsor the Ebony Show in September. - Harris Photos"
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Dolly Mellix wearing light colored zippered pantsuit with cuffs, holding light colored jacket with covered buttons, standing in front of light colored curtain in the Holiday House for the D.I. annual benefit for the National Foundation
